title: Print, "A plate from the set of twelve projects for engraved silver cups (12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg)", 1580
medium: Punch engraving, pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark: bear with collar and hanging tongue (horizontal)
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, center upper margin: 122; in graphite, center lower margin: 10
provenance: Prince Waldburg-Wolfegg; 1942: acquired by Museum (from P. and D. Colnaghi and Co., Ltd.)
dimensions:
Sheet: 29.5 x 18.5 cm (11 5/8 x 7 5/16 in.)
Platemark: 23.4 x 15.3 cm (9 3/16 in. x 6 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Scrollwork frieze with a head with a feather headgear in the center. A mustached mask with feather gear, a cherub mask, and a bunch of fruit below.

participants.person_name: P. and D. Colnaghi and Co., Ltd.

tombstone.epitaph: Print, "A plate from the set of twelve projects for engraved silver cups (12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg)", 1580. Punch engraving, pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1942-36-17.
